courses: CS 597: Advanced Computational Topics in Robotics

projects.name: Wayfinding Assistant: WayBot
projects.summary: Researching haptic interfaces for a wayfinding robotic assistant for people with visual impairments.

projects.name: Bio-Informatics in Plant Science
projects.summary: Developed a software setup to automate data collection for a plant science research project.
highlights: Won an Outstanding Award for Abstract Writing at the Spring 21' Undergraduate Research Forum

projects.name: Cybersecurity Research Experience for Undergraduates
projects.summary: Worked with Prof. Jeremy Straub to develop a simulator for predicting the spread of cyberattacks in organizations affected by a pandemic.
highlights: Presented work at the 2020 IEEE Applied Imagery Pattern Recognition Workshop.

work.name: CrowdStrike
work.summary: Developed detection logic for Windows Defender tampering to increase security visibility.

work.name: University of Missouri Department of Computer Science
work.summary: Assisted with grading for 45 students, held office hours and co-led review sessions for CS 1050: Algorithm Design and Programming I.

work.name: Caterpillar
work.summary: Created a MATLAB simulation to model IMU sensor error based on technical specification documents.

awards.title: High Dean's List
awards.awarder: University of Missouri College of Engineering
awards.summary: Awarded each semester a student achieves a GPA of 3.5 or higher

awards.title: Oustanding Award for Abstract Writing
awards.awarder: Undergraduate Research and Creative Achievements Forum
awards.summary: Awarded to the best student abstracts in each research category.

awards.title: Discovery Fellows
awards.summary: Award to provide support for undergraduate research.

publications.name: SPITE: Simple Polyhedral Intersection Techniques for modified Environments
publications.summary: An improved method for motion planning in modified environments using dynamic roadmaps is presented. Extended abstract version accepted to ICRA@40 Conference in 2024. Submitted to WAFR 2024.

publications.name: Dependable Spanners via Unreliable Edges
publications.summary: Demonstrates the construction of reliable t-spanners capable of surviving edge failures.

publications.name: Determining the Impact of Cybersecurity Failures During and Attributable to Pandemics and Other Emergency Situations
publications.summary: This paper presents a simulator for predicting the spread of cyberattacks in organizations affected by a pandemic.

volunteer.summary: Organized and led a competiton team to design and build an Autonomous Underwater Vehicle for the RoboSub competition.
highlights: Created take home kits and instructional videos for the STEM Cubs outreach program, serving underrepresented elementary school students in the area.
